page.title: 15Arnold's Wood,Hutton
page.content: We set off at 11.45 for one of our visits.We walked and walked and tried our best to keep up with our teacher but his stride is three of mine. As we got near the railway the stinging nettles got quite out of hand.Every time one stung,you cried ouch and stumbled. We were going to look at,amongst other things,Arnolds Wood which is behind the housing estate. Some farmers wanted to fell just over 2.5 acres and so reduce the problems of crops shading and discourage vandalism.Essex County Council said this could not be allowed because the 10 acre woodland might date back to the Ice Age. The Council did say that the wood could be coppiced over a maximum of four seasons.This is good management for without coppicing,plants and animals would die.
